document.masterDocTitle: The bees of the genus Hylaeus FABRICIUS, 1793 of Turkey, with keys to the subgenera and species (Hymenoptera: Anthophila, Colletidae)

Remarks:
H. soror
is recorded almost throughout the country, preferring areas with a continental climate at altitudes from 600 m to 2200 m ( Hakkâri ). It can be considered as an inhabitant of warm and dry habitat types living in steppes and open areas, sometimes even in cool and mountainous environments. The flight season extends from late May to early September with a peak in July. Flower visits were observed at
Euphorbia altissima
,
Marrubium parviflorum
and
Polygonum sp.
It is frequently collected in Turkey (28 provinces).

Distribution: Western Palaearctic. Turkey : Adıyaman , Ağrı , Aksaray , Ankara , Antalya , Bingöl , Burdur , Bursa , Diyarbakır , Erzurum , Hakkâri , Kahramanmaraş , Kars , Kayseri , Kırşehir , Konya , Kütahya , Malatya , Mardin , Mersin , Muğla , Nevşehir , Niğde , Şırnak , Tunceli , Uşak , Van , Yalova .

The papers by WARNCKE (1972 ff.) provide no information, because he treated this species as a synonym of
H. sinuatus
.
